comments:
I get a NPE exception to occur occasionally when saving a file when my java projects src folder is linked to a remote folder on an ftp.  It generally happens when I save the file and notice a mistake, fix it quickly and do another save.  

The save looks like Eclipse is frozen and if you wait 1-2 mins then you will get the NPE error.

Javier can you investigate? Perhaps Eclipse tries to close the file twice.

FYI, as far as I know Kevin is working on a JDT Java project shared from an FTP-based remote EFS folder. Let us know if you need any advice how to setup / reproduce the issue. 

Kevin, for you the setup is already done -- if you have any idea what's going wrong or you could debug the issue (e.g. set a Java Exception Breakpoint to catch NPE, then see what's going wrong) that would also be helpful.

I worked on my project more and haven't been able to hit this again.  I was using my main machine though and I originally had this happen twice on my laptop.  I'll try using my laptop next time I use EFS.
